summary.long: 1 John is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: What existed from the beginning, what we have heard, what we have seen with our eyes, what we observed and touched with our own hands—this is the Word of life!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This life was revealed to us, and we have seen it and testify about it. We declare to you this eternal life that was with the Father and was revealed to us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What we have seen and heard we declare to you so that you, too, can have fellowship with us. Now this fellowship of ours is with the Father and with his Son, Jesus, the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are writing these things so that our joy may be full.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the message that we have heard from him and declare to you: God is light, and in him there is no darkness—none at all!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we claim that we have fellowship with him but keep living in darkness, we are lying and not practicing the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if we keep living in the light as he himself is in the light, we have fellowship with one another, and the blood of Jesus his Son cleanses us from all sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we say that we do not have any sin, we are deceiving ourselves and we’re not being truthful to ourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we make it our habit to confess our sins, in his faithful righteousness he forgives us for those sins and cleanses us from all unrighteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we say that we have never sinned, we make him a liar and his word has no place in us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My little children, I’m writing these things to you so that you might not sin. Yet if anyone does sin, we have an advocate with the Father—Jesus, the Messiah, one who is righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is he who is the atoning sacrifice for our sins, and not for ours only, but also for the whole world’s.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is how we can be sure that we have come to know him: if we continually keep his commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The person who says, “I have come to know him,” but does not continually keep his commandments is a liar, and the truth has no place in that person.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But whoever continually keeps his commandments is the kind of person in whom God’s love has truly been perfected. This is how we can be sure that we are in union with God:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who says that he abides in him must live the same way he himself lived.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dear friends, I am not writing to you a new commandment, but an old commandment that you have had from the beginning. This old commandment is the word you have heard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the other hand, I am writing to you a new commandment that is truly in him and in you. For the darkness is fading away, and the true light is already shining.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The person who says that he is in the light but hates his brother is still in the darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The person who loves his brother abides in the light, and there is no reason for him to stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the person who hates his brother is in the darkness and lives in the darkness. He does not know where he is going, because the darkness has blinded his eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am writing to you, little children,
    because your sins have been forgiven
        on account of his name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am writing to you, fathers,
    because you have known the one who
        has existed from the beginning.
I am writing to you, young people,
    because you have overcome the evil one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have written to you, little children,
    because you have known the Father.
I have written to you, fathers,
    because you have known the one who
        has existed from the beginning.
I have written to you, young people,
    because you are strong
    and because God’s word remains in you
        and you have overcome the evil one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Stop loving the world and the things that are in the world. If anyone persists in loving the world, the Father’s love is not in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For everything that is in the world—the desire for fleshly gratification, the desire for possessions, and worldly arrogance—is not from the Father but is from the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the world and its desires are fading away, but the person who does God’s will remains forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Little children, it is the last hour. Just as you heard that an antichrist is coming, so now many antichrists have appeared. This is how we know it is the last hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They left us, but they were not part of us, for if they had been part of us, they would have stayed with us. Their leaving made it clear that none of them was really part of us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have an anointing from the Holy One and know all things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have not written to you because you do not know the truth, but because you do know it and because lies don’t come from truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who is a liar but the person who denies that Jesus is the Messiah? The person who denies the Father and the Son is an antichrist.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one who denies the Son has the Father. The person who acknowledges the Son also has the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What you have heard from the beginning must abide in you. If what you have heard from the beginning abides in you, you will also abide in the Son and in the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The message that the Son himself declared to us is eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have written to you about those who are trying to deceive you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The anointing you received from God abides in you, and you do not need anyone to teach you this. Instead, because God’s anointing teaches you about everything and is true and not a lie, abide in him, as he taught you to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even now, little children, abide in him. Then, when he appears, we will have confidence and will not turn away from him in shame when he comes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since you know that he is righteous, you also know that everyone who practices righteousness has been fathered by God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See what kind of love the Father has given us: We are called God’s children—and that is what we are! For this reason the world does not recognize us, because it did not recognize him, either.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dear friends, we are now God’s children, but what we will be like has not been revealed yet. We know that when the Messiah is revealed, we will be like him, because we will see him as he is.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And everyone who has this hope based on him keeps himself pure, just as the Messiah is pure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who keeps living in sin also practices disobedience. In fact, sin is disobedience.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know that the Messiah was revealed to take away sins, and there is not any sin in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one who remains in union with him keeps on sinning. The one who keeps on sinning hasn’t seen him or known him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Little children, don’t let anyone deceive you. The person who practices righteousness is righteous, just as the Messiah is righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The person who practices sin belongs to the evil one, because the Devil has been sinning from the beginning. The reason that the Son of God was revealed was to destroy what the Devil has been doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one who has been born from God practices sin, because God’s seed abides in him. Indeed, he cannot go on sinning, because he has been born from God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is how God’s children and the Devil’s children are distinguished. No person who fails to practice righteousness and to love his brother is from God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the message that you have heard from the beginning: We should love one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not be like Cain, who was from the evil one and murdered his brother. And why did he murder him? Because what he was doing was evil and his brother’s actions were righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So do not be surprised, brothers, if the world hates you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We know that we have passed from death to life, because we love one another. The person who does not love remains spiritually dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who hates his brother is a murderer, and you know that no murderer has eternal life present in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is how we have come to know love: the Messiah gave his life for us. We, too, ought to give our lives for our brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever has earthly possessions and notices a brother in need and yet withholds his compassion from him, how can the love of God be present in him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Little children, we must stop expressing love merely by our words and manner of speech; we must love also in action and in truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is how we will know that we belong to the truth and how we will be able to keep ourselves strong in his presence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If our hearts condemn us, God is greater than our hearts and knows everything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dear friends, if our hearts do not condemn us, we have confidence in the presence of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whatever we request we receive from him, because we keep his commandments and do what pleases him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this is his commandment: to believe in the name of his Son, Jesus the Messiah, and to love one another as he commanded us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The person who keeps his commandments abides in God, and God abides in him. This is how we can be sure that he remains in us: he has given us his Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dear friends, stop believing every spirit. Instead, test the spirits to see whether they are from God, because many false prophets have gone out into the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is how you can recognize God’s Spirit: Every spirit who acknowledges that Jesus the Messiah has become human—and remains so—is from God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But every spirit who does not acknowledge Jesus is not from God. This is the spirit of the antichrist. You have heard that he is coming, and now he is already in the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Little children, you belong to God and have overcome them, because the one who is in you is greater than the one who is in the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These people belong to the world. That is why they speak from the world’s perspective, and the world listens to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We belong to God. The person who knows God listens to us. Whoever does not belong to God does not listen to us. This is how we know the Spirit of truth and the spirit of deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dear friends, let us continuously love one another, because love comes from God. Everyone who loves has been born from God and knows God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The person who does not love does not know God, because God is love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is how God’s love was revealed among us: God sent his uniquely existing Son into the world so that we might live through him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is love: not that we have loved God, but that he loved us and sent his Son to be the atoning sacrifice for our sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dear friends, if this is the way God loved us, we must also love one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one has ever seen God. If we love one another, God lives in us, and his love is perfected in us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is how we know that we abide in him and he in us: he has given us his Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have seen for ourselves and can testify that the Father has sent his Son to be the Savior of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God abides in the one who acknowledges that Jesus is the Son of God, and he abides in God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have come to know and rely on the love that God has for us. God is love, and the person who abides in love abides in God, and God abides in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is how love has been perfected among us: we will have confidence on the day of judgment because, during our time in this world, we are just like him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is no fear where love exists. Rather, perfect love banishes fear, for fear involves punishment, and the person who lives in fear has not been perfected in love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We love because God first loved us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever says, “I love God,” but hates his brother is a liar. The one who does not love his brother whom he has seen cannot love the God whom he has not seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this is the commandment that we have from him: the person who loves God must also love his brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who believes that Jesus is the Messiah has been born from God, and everyone who loves the parent also loves the child.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is how we know that we love God’s children: we love God and keep his commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this demonstrates our love for God: We keep his commandments, and his commandments are not difficult,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because everyone who is born from God has overcome the world. Our faith is the victory that overcomes the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who overcomes the world? Is it not the person who believes that Jesus is the Son of God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This man, Jesus the Messiah, is the one who came by water and blood—not with water only, but with water and with blood. The Spirit is the one who verifies this, because the Spirit is the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there are three witnesses in heaven—the Father, the Word, and the Holy Spirit, and these three are one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there are three witness on earth—the Spirit, the water, and the blood—and these three are one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we accept human testimony, God’s testimony is greater, because it is the testimony of God and because he has testified about his Son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The person who believes in the Son of God believes this testimony personally. The person who does not believe God has made him a liar by not believing the testimony that he has given about his Son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the testimony: God has given us eternal life, and this life is found in his Son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The person who has the Son has this life. The person who does not have the Son of God does not have this life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have written these things to you who believe in the name of the Son of God so that you may know that you have eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this is the confidence that we have in him: if we ask for anything according to his will, he listens to us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if we know that he listens to our requests, we can be sure that we have what we ask him for.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone sees his brother committing a sin that does not lead to death, he should pray that God would give him life. This applies to those who commit sins that do not lead to death. There is a sin that leads to death. I am not telling you to pray about that.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every kind of wrongdoing is sin, yet there are sins that do not lead to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We know that the person who has been born from God does not go on sinning. Rather, the Son of God protects them, and the evil one cannot harm them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We know that we are from God and that the whole world lies under the control of the evil one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We also know that the Son of God has come and has given us understanding so that we may know the true God. We are in union with the one who is true, his Son Jesus the Messiah, who is the true God and eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Little children, keep yourselves away from idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator
